alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:51PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster and southwestern Dutchess Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Highland, or near Poughkeepsie, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, New Paltz, Hyde Park, Wappingers Falls, Highland, Fairview, Hopewell Junction, Marlboro, Red Oaks Mill, Myers Corner, Lloyd, Tuckers Corner, Knapps Corner, New Hamburg, Elting Corners, Haviland, Stoneco, Chelsea, Colonial Heights and Arlington. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
